com.nttdocomo.ui
Class Font

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Font
public class Font
extends java.lang.Object

This defines character types. The font class handles fonts and font metrics. The getFont argument has the following formats.
When designating type, the last 8 bits indicates the type. Other bits shall all be 0. 

 |<- 4 ->|<- 4 ->|<----- 8 ----->|<----- 8 ----->|<----- 8 ----->|
 +-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+
 |   0   |   0   |       0       |       0       |     type      |
 +-------+-------+---------------+---------------+-------+-------+
When designating the face, size and style, the first four bits are 0111. The next four bits indicate face, the 8 bits after that style, and the 8 bits after that size. The last 8 bits are ignored. 
 |<- 4 ->|<- 4 ->|<----- 8 ----->|<----- 8 ----->|<----- 8 ----->|
 +-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+
 | 0111  | face  |     style     |     size      |       -       |
 +-------+-------+---------------+---------------+-------+-------+
The default font is FACE_SYSTEM|SIZE_MEDIUM|STYLE_PLAIN. When the type designated by getFont is not supported, the default font is obtained. When the face, size and style designated by getFont are not supported, the fonts with the unsupported elements replaced by FACE_SYSTEM, SIZE_MEDIUM and STYLE_PLAN shall be obtained.

Method Detail

getDefaultFont

public static Font getDefaultFont()
This obtains the default font.

Returns:
The default font object

getFont

public static Font getFont(int type)
This obtains the font object designated by the argument. There are two methods for designating the font. One is designating the type and the another is designating the face, style and size of the font.

Type designating
When TYPE_DEFAULT is designated with argument type, the implementation-defined default font shall be used.

Face, style and size designating
Designates the constant for the face, style and size in the argument type using the logical sum of bits. For example, when obtaining a system font, bold style and medium size, the font shall be designated by the equation below.
f = getFont(FACE_SYSTEM|STYLE_BOLD|SIZE_MEDIUM);
Make sure that the logical sum of bits is used. When designating the font face, style and size, even if TYPE_DEFAULT and TYPE_HEADING are designated at the same time, these designations shall be ignored.
In either designation method, an alternative font object shall be returned when the UE does not have the designated font.
Some systems generate font objects statically and the same object may be returned when the same font type is designated.

Parameters:
type - Designates the font type.
Returns:
This shall return font objects.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is designated for the argument type.

getLineBreak

public int getLineBreak(java.lang.String str,
                        int off,
                        int len,
                        int width)
This obtains the line feeding location for the designated character string. When the character string width from off to len is longer than the width, the character string location that will be the next line head will be returned. When this width is shorter than the width, off+len shall be returned as the return value. For an example, 
  String s = "Programming";
  int idx = font.getLineBreak(s, 0, s.length, 50);
When the width of "Prog" is 48 pixels and that of "Progra" is 60 pixels, the idx value is 4. This location is the location of the next line start.
The following is a usage example. This method displays the character string by line feeding it at the width from the designated coordinate (x, y). However, the y coordinate is the y coordinate of the base line. 
 
  public void drawText(Graphics g, Font f, String str, int x, int y, int width) {
      int len = str.length();
      char data[] = new char[len];
      str.getChars(0, len, data, 0);
      int startIdx = 0;
      int endIdx = 0;
      int h = f.getHeight();
      while (len > 0) {
         endIdx = f.getLineBreak(str, startIdx, len, width);
         g.drawChars(data, x, y, startIdx, endIdx - startIdx);
         len -= (endIdx - startIdx);
         startIdx = endIdx;
         y += h;
      }
  }

Parameters:
str - Designates the character string.
off - Designates the offset of the calculated character string.
len - Designates the length of the calculated character string.
width - Designates the line width in pixel units.
Returns:
The offset of the next line feeding location.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for the argument str.
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - Generated when a negative value is designated for argument off or len or when the lengths of argument off or argument off+len is longer than the length of str.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when a negative value is designated for the argument width.

getAscent

public int getAscent()
This obtains the font ascent (the length from the base line to the top edge).

Returns:
The font ascent.

getDescent

public int getDescent()
This obtains the font descent (length from the base line to the bottom edge).

Returns:
The font descent.

getHeight

public int getHeight()
This obtains the font height. This value shall be equal to the sum of ascent and descent.

Returns:
The font height.
